definition: Wellington, capital of New Zealand (Tw)/Wellington (name)/Arthur Wellesley, Duke of Wellington (1769-1851)
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: Seldon the Master of Wellington College, one of the most prestigeous schools in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 威灵顿公学是英国最受尊重的学校之一。

sentences.english: Bfter a long campaign, the Duke of Willington's army defeated Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 颠末长长的战争，威灵顿公爵的部队打败了拿破仑。

sentences.english: After a long campaign, the Duke of Willington's army defeated Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 经过长长的战役，威灵顿公爵的军队战胜了拿破仑。

sentences.english: We have the support of the Mayor of Fremantle and the Mayor of Wellington.
sentences.chinese: 我们也有弗里曼特尔市长和威灵顿市长的背书。

sentences.english: Wellington perceived it, and thought of his cavalry.
sentences.chinese: 威灵顿见了，想到了他的骑兵。

sentences.english: Wellington is nothing but a hero like many another.
sentences.chinese: 威灵顿只是个平凡的英雄。
威灵顿立在那里，冷峻而英勇。

sentences.english: Wellington went to the village of Waterloo to draw up his report to Lord Bathurst.
sentences.chinese: 威灵顿回到滑铁卢村里写军书，向贵人巴塞司特报捷。

sentences.english: England has been too modest in the matter of Wellington.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰在威灵顿眼前过于妄自菲薄了。

sentences.english: To make Wellington so great is to belittle England.
sentences.chinese: 把威灵顿捧得那样高便是小看了英格兰。

sentences.english: Napoleon encountered Wellington in the Battle of Waterloo.
sentences.chinese: 拿破伦在滑铁卢之役与威灵顿会战。

sentences.english: Soldiers from the barracks will take part in various aspects of the royal wedding.
sentences.chinese: 威灵顿军营的士兵将全全参与皇室婚礼。

definition: the Franks (Germanic people who arrived in Europe from 600 AD and took over France)
